basics.label: English Language Arts Teacher
basics.summary: Experienced educator� who over the past� 13 years� employed a broad range of techniques and teaching strategies to retain student interest, differentiate instruction, and maximize individual learning by gaining immediate feedback through data analysis with use of instructional management systems and best practices.

work.name: Company Name
highlights: Rated as 'highly effective' in the category of Collegiality and Professionalism in 2013-2014
Recognized by the Florida Department of Education as a High Impact Teacher in 2014-15 / 2015-16
Received a 4.0 student growth rating in 2015-2016
Selected to create mini benchmarks for the county ELA department using Unify - Summer 2016
Chosen as a Mentor for other teachers; completed OCPS Clinical Educator Training
Assessed as 'highly effective' with selected Deliberate Practice Elements three of four years using Marzano's Model of instructional methods
Selected to pilot the VIEWpath camera technologies and other evaluation tools using Insight Advance to improve instructional practices
Modeled instruction and hosted campus tours including: OCPS leaders, Future of Educational Technology Tours (FETC), and Broad Foundation Scholarship evaluation team (2014)

work.name: Company Name
work.summary: Developed individualized behavioral and developmental plans for children with Autism Spectrum Disorders; Developed behavior modification plans for staff, teachers, parents, and children. Supervised clinical team members with implementation of strategies for behavioral interventions. Managed staff during home and school therapy sessions. Provided professional development supervision for support staff. Coordinated and collaborated with Psychologists, school officials, insurance providers, occupational and speech therapists

skills.name: Teaching
keywords: Used Turning Point technologies - rapid responders
Earned over 50 hours of continuing education per calendar year
Worked collaboratively as member of Professional Learning Community
Familiar with concepts of Instructional design (PLC)
Developed assessments to adhere to state testing format, functionality and Common Core Standards
